bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 173 (Friday, December 2, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. SLAUGHTER:H.R. 6432.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the Constitution of the UnitedStates.[Page H7144]

item.title: To require the Secretary of Labor to monitor the trade deficits between the United States and other countries, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

Trade Deficit Reduction Act

This bill requires the Department of Labor to annually identify each country for which the following apply:

  • the value of goods and services imported into the United States exceeds twice the value of goods and services exported from the United States to that country, or $100 billion; or
  • the value of goods and services imported into and exported from the United States exceeds $1 billion.

Labor shall convene a meeting of the Trade Policy Review Group to develop trade deficit reduction plans with such countries.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
